page.title: 17ECOLOGY
page.content: In West Linton there is a tree preservation order on key areas of the woodland of the village area. There is very little natural woodland. The forests and woodland areas were planted delibrately mainly as windbreaks during the last 100-150 years. These windbreaks also provide shelter for a variety of wild life that lives here. As wildlife is found here there is a lot of game shooting. Geese are shot on Mendick Hill as they fly to and from Westwater reservoir. The land on both sides of the A702 towards Biggar is very sandy and therefore quite productive. The sand is even mined at a quarry beyond Ingraston farm .
